bioghist.p: Fred Burton (born in 1882) was son of Clarence M. Burton (1853-1932), Detroit lawyer, businessman, philantropist, and founder of the Burton Historical Collection at the Detroit Public Library. Clarence Burton founded the Burton Abstract Company in 1893. By the 1950s the company had offices in Pleasant Ridge, Ann Arbor, Pontiac, and Lapeer.

scopecontent.p: The Abstract of Title documents the history of property ownership and contains transdcripts of mortgages, warranty deeds, claims, and other documentation, dated from 1824 to 1956. According to the Abstract, the property's first owner was John Allen, co-founder of Ann Arbor. Also included a copy of 1986 Mortgage Report and a letter from Great Lakes Federal Savings addressed to one of the previous owners, dated 1981.
